intro: Grangea jeffreyana, commonly known as the Jeffrey's grangea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically range in color from pink to red. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a sunny to partially shaded environment. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
